meta.title: Clash of Clans UI/Visual Reference
meta.purpose: Descriptive reference for building a browser game UI inspired by Clash of Clans visual design language
meta.note: All values are descriptive approximations based on in-game observation, not extracted from game source files

terrain.description: The village base sits on a bright green grassy field. Terrain colors vary slightly depending on obstacles (trees, rocks, bushes). The outer edges of the map show sand/beach transitioning to water.

uiPanels.description: UI panels use a dark navy/charcoal background with gold or bronze borders. The panels are semi-transparent, allowing the village to show through slightly. Corners are typically rounded with a beveled or embossed look.

resources.description: Gold is a rich yellow-gold with occasional shine highlights. Elixir is a vibrant pink-purple with a glowing effect. Dark Elixir is a deep purple-black, almost tar-like. Gems are bright green crystals. Each resource icon in the HUD has a distinct shape: gold is a coin stack, elixir is a flask/drop, dark elixir is a drop with a darker hue, gems are a green diamond.

healthBars.description: Health bars appear above buildings and troops during attacks. They transition from green (full health) through yellow (medium) to red (critical). The bar sits on a dark background with a thin black border. The bar width is proportional to the unit or building size.

buttons.description: Buttons use a bold, 3D beveled style with darker borders on the bottom and right to create a raised appearance. Upgrade buttons are bright green. Purchase/buy buttons are orange. Train buttons are blue. Cancel buttons are red. Disabled buttons are grayed out. All buttons have white text with a slight shadow.

text.description: Primary text is white with a subtle dark outline/shadow for readability over the game background. Resource numbers use the color of their respective resource. Insufficient resource amounts turn red. Level badges use gold text inside a gold circle. Floating damage numbers during attacks appear in red, healing in green.

backgrounds.description: Loading screens use a deep blue background with the Supercell logo and game art. Menu overlays darken the background. Chat panels use a dark blue-gray. League badges use metallic colors corresponding to their tier.

grid.tileShape: Diamond/rhombus when viewed from the isometric angle
grid.viewAngle: Approximately 30-degree top-down isometric angle, looking from the south-southwest
grid.rotation: The camera angle is fixed; players cannot rotate the view
grid.zoom: Players can pinch-to-zoom between a close-up view and a full village overview
grid.edgeBuffer: A border of impassable terrain (trees, rocks, water) surrounds the buildable area
grid.description: The village sits on an isometric grid where each tile appears as a diamond shape. Buildings snap to grid positions. The grid is not visible by default but becomes apparent when moving buildings in edit mode, where green/red tile highlights show valid/invalid placement.

1x1.description: Walls occupy a single tile and connect visually to adjacent wall segments, forming continuous lines or enclosures.

2x2.description: Traps and small utility buildings. Many traps are hidden from attackers until triggered.

3x3.description: The most common building footprint. Most defenses, resource buildings, and army buildings use this size. They have enough visual real estate to show detailed artwork and level-specific decoration.

4x4.description: The largest buildings. The Town Hall is the centerpiece of the village and visually the most elaborate. These buildings command visual attention and are typically placed centrally or in protected positions.

5x5.description: Army Camps have a slightly larger visual footprint showing tents and resting troops, though their placement grid may differ.

topBar.layout: Horizontal bar across the top of the screen, left to right
topBar.background: Semi-transparent dark gradient, darker at top fading to transparent

elements.icon: Blue shield icon with clock overlay
elements.interaction: Tap to see shield details, Personal Break Timer info
Tap to view star bonus reward details

elements.plusButton: Small green '+' circle to buy more gems

elements.interaction: Tap to view dark elixir details
Tap to cycle through active builder tasks
elements.gemOption: Option to gem (speed up) builder tasks

bottomBar.layout: Horizontal bar across the bottom of the screen

elements.icon: Crossed swords on a red/orange shield
elements.interaction: Tap to search for a multiplayer opponent
elements.description: The primary action button, visually the most prominent element in the bottom bar. Uses a bold red/orange color to attract attention.

elements.icon: Troop silhouettes or army camp icon
elements.interaction: Tap to open army training/management screen
Tap to open clan chat panel (slides in from right)

contextualElements.builderTimers: When builders are active, small countdown timers appear near the bottom showing remaining upgrade/build time for each active builder
contextualElements.eventBanner: Seasonal or special event banners occasionally appear at the top of the screen with animated effects
contextualElements.notificationBadges: Red circles with white numbers appear on buttons when actions are available (e.g., troops ready, upgrade complete)

primaryFont.name: Supercell Magic
primaryFont.usage: Headers, button text, building names, resource numbers
primaryFont.description: Supercell's proprietary font family. Characters are thick, rounded, and highly readable even at small sizes. The font has a playful, hand-drawn quality that matches the game's cartoon aesthetic. All caps is common for headers and buttons.

numberFormatting.abbreviated: K for thousands, M for millions (e.g., '1.2M', '500K')
numberFormatting.abbreviated_usage: Used in resource counters when numbers get large, in loot displays during attacks, and in upgrade cost previews
numberFormatting.description: Numbers use a slightly condensed variant of the main font. Large numbers are typically abbreviated. Timer countdowns show the two most significant units.

levelBadge.position: Bottom-left or bottom-right corner of the building sprite
levelBadge.description: Every building displays its current level in a small gold badge. The badge uses a bold white number with a dark outline for contrast against the gold background.

buildingNames.style: Bold, white, centered above building info panel
buildingNames.shadow: Dark text shadow or outline for readability
buildingNames.size: Medium-large, prominent in the info popup

tooltipText.style: Regular weight, white or light gray
tooltipText.usage: Stat descriptions, info text, help text

damageNumbers.style: Bold, floating upward with fade-out animation
damageNumbers.color: Red for damage, green for healing
damageNumbers.animation: Pops up from the point of impact and drifts upward while fading out over about 1 second

buildingInfoPopup.trigger: Tap on any building in your own village

appearance.background: Dark semi-transparent panel (navy/charcoal), roughly 60-70% of screen width
appearance.border: Gold/bronze ornamental border with corner flourishes
appearance.position: Appears above or below the selected building, connected by a small triangular pointer
appearance.animation: Pops in with a slight scale-up bounce effect

content.header: Building name in bold white text, centered
content.levelIndicator: Level number displayed below the name (e.g., 'Level 12')

upgradeButton.costDisplay: Resource icon + amount (e.g., gold coin icon + '3,500,000')
upgradeButton.disabledState: Grayed out if insufficient resources or no available builder
upgradeButton.description: Large, prominent button at the bottom of the info popup. Shows the resource cost and upgrade time. If the player lacks resources, the cost text turns red.

infoButton.position: Upper right of the popup or alongside upgrade button
infoButton.action: Opens a detailed stats page showing all levels and stats progression

actionButtons.description: Below or around the info panel, contextual action buttons appear
examples: Boost (for resource collectors, uses gems or magic items)
Finish Now (gem cost to instantly complete)

upgradeConfirmation.content: Shows before/after stats comparison, cost, and time. Requires confirmation tap.
upgradeConfirmation.description: A secondary confirmation panel showing the stat improvements from upgrading.

shopPanel.trigger: Tap the shop button (usually accessed from builder or main menu)
shopPanel.layout: Full-screen overlay with category tabs across the top

categories.name: Defenses
categories.items: Defensive buildings available to build at current TH level

categories.name: Army
categories.items: Army camps, barracks, spell factories, hero altars

categories.name: Resources
categories.items: Gold mines, elixir collectors, storages, drills

categories.name: Decorations
categories.items: Decorative items and special event items

itemDisplay.name: Building name below thumbnail
itemDisplay.cost: Resource icon + amount, or gem icon for special items
itemDisplay.available: Green highlight if buildable, grayed if max count reached or TH requirement not met
itemDisplay.thRequirement: Shows required Town Hall level if locked

armyOverview.trigger: Tap the army button in the bottom bar
armyOverview.layout: Full-screen panel with sections for troops, spells, siege machines, and heroes

sections.name: Troops
sections.display: Grid of troop icons with trained count overlay, organized by barracks type (regular and dark)

sections.name: Spells
sections.display: Grid of spell icons with brew count, organized by regular and dark spells

sections.name: Heroes
sections.display: Hero portraits with level badge and ability level
sections.status: Shows if hero is upgrading, sleeping, or ready

trainButton.action: Opens the troop training queue interface

quickTrain.description: Preset army compositions that can be trained with a single tap. Three customizable slots.

laboratoryPanel.layout: Grid of troop and spell icons showing upgrade availability

itemDisplay.available: Full color icon with green arrow indicator
itemDisplay.maxLevel: Icon with gold star or checkmark
itemDisplay.inProgress: Timer overlay showing remaining research time

laboratoryPanel.upgradeInfo: Shows current level, next level stats, cost (elixir or dark elixir), and research time

clanCastlePanel.content: Shows donated troops stored inside with icons and levels
clanCastlePanel.requestButton: Button to request troops from clanmates with a text field for the request message

scoutView.description: Before deploying troops, the player can scout the enemy base. The base is shown with all buildings visible (except hidden traps). A 30-second scout timer counts down before the battle timer starts.
elements: Enemy player name and clan at top
Available loot (gold, elixir, dark elixir) shown with icons
'Next' button to skip to another opponent (costs gold)

troopSwap.description: Before attacking, players can tap green arrows to rearrange the order of troops in the deployment bar

elements.style: Large white text, updates in real-time as buildings are destroyed

elements.display: Three star outlines that fill in gold as earned (1 star = 50% destruction or Town Hall, 2 stars = Town Hall + 50%, 3 stars = 100%)
elements.style: Gold filled stars vs gray empty star outlines
White text, turns red in the final 60 seconds

elements.display: Running total of gold, elixir, and dark elixir looted so far

deploymentBar.position: Bottom of screen, horizontal scrollable bar

troopSlots.countBadge: Small number in corner showing remaining count of that troop type
troopSlots.levelBadge: Small level indicator on the troop icon
troopSlots.selectedState: Highlighted border/glow when selected for deployment
troopSlots.emptyState: Grayed out or removed after all units of that type are deployed
troopSlots.description: Troops are displayed as square icons in the bottom bar. Tapping a troop selects it (highlighted), then tapping on the battlefield deploys it. The remaining count decreases with each deployment.

heroSlots.abilityIndicator: Glowing border or special icon when ability is ready to activate
heroSlots.abilityActivation: Tap the hero portrait during battle to trigger their special ability
heroSlots.cooldown: After ability use, portrait dims or shows cooldown state
heroSlots.description: Heroes have larger icons than regular troops. Their ability can be activated by tapping their portrait once they are deployed. An iron fist (Barbarian King), golden arrow (Archer Queen), or similar icon indicates the ability is ready.

spellSlots.display: Circular icons showing spell image, positioned after or alongside troop slots
spellSlots.selectedState: Highlighted when selected, then tap on battlefield to place
spellSlots.rangeIndicator: When selected, a radius circle may appear on the battlefield showing the spell's area of effect
spellSlots.description: Spells are displayed as circular icons. Selecting a spell and tapping the battlefield places it at that location. Spells affect a circular area.

siegeSlot.display: Larger icon for the siege machine
siegeSlot.position: Typically at one end of the deployment bar
siegeSlot.description: The siege machine slot shows the selected siege machine. It must be deployed with or after Clan Castle troops.

endBattleButton.position: Top right or upper right corner of the screen
endBattleButton.color: Red background with white flag icon
endBattleButton.confirmation: Tapping triggers a confirmation dialog ('End Battle?' with Yes/No)
endBattleButton.description: Allows the player to end the battle early, forfeiting remaining deployment time but keeping any loot and stars already earned.

duringAttack.pauseNote: There is no pause button during multiplayer attacks; the timer runs continuously

elements: Stars earned (1-3, displayed prominently with animation)
Loot gained (gold, elixir, dark elixir amounts)

replayControls.description: During replay playback, controls appear for play/pause, speed (1x, 2x, 4x), and a timeline scrubber bar

villageEditing.enterEditMode: Long-press on any building, or tap the edit mode button (pencil/wrench icon)

editModeUI.gridOverlay: Faint grid lines become visible on the terrain, showing tile boundaries
editModeUI.validPlacement: Green highlighted tiles indicate the building can be placed here
editModeUI.invalidPlacement: Red highlighted tiles indicate the building cannot be placed here (occupied or out of bounds)
editModeUI.wallTool: Special wall placement mode allows rapid sequential wall placement by dragging
editModeUI.selectAll: Button to select all buildings of a certain type
editModeUI.confirmButton: Green checkmark to confirm the new layout
editModeUI.cancelButton: Red X to revert changes and exit edit mode
editModeUI.stashButton: A 'stash' area to temporarily store buildings off the grid while rearranging

buildingUpgrade.description: During upgrade, the building is covered by a builder's scaffolding (wooden frame with tarp). A builder character hammers at the building. A timer and progress bar appear above.

resourceCollection.description: Resource collectors show animated elements: gold mines have spinning gears, elixir collectors have bubbling liquid, dark elixir drills have pumping motion. When resources are ready to collect, a resource icon floats above the building and can be tapped.

troopDeployment.description: Troops appear with a small poof/smoke animation at the deployment point. They then begin their AI-driven movement toward targets.

defenseFireing.description: Each defense has a unique firing animation: cannons show a muzzle flash and cannonball trajectory, archer towers show arrow flight, wizard towers show magical bolts, inferno towers show continuous beam or multi-target beams, eagle artillery shows long-range explosive shells with a targeting reticle on the impact point.

destruction.description: Destroyed buildings collapse with debris particles, dust clouds, and a brief fire effect. The rubble remains for the duration of the attack.

starEarned.description: When a star is earned during attack, it flies into position at the top of the screen with a golden burst animation and sparkle effect.

lootCollection.description: After an attack, loot numbers fly upward from storage buildings as they are destroyed, with gold coins, elixir drops, or dark elixir drops scattering visually.

elements: Clash of Clans logo (bold, 3D metallic text with sword crossing through)
Loading bar at bottom (gold fill on dark background)
Gameplay tip/hint text in white below the loading bar

warScreen.layout: Split view showing your clan (left) vs enemy clan (right)
elements: Clan badges and names at top
Member list with attack status indicators

clanCapital.description: A separate village view with a different terrain aesthetic (mountainous/elevated). Uses the same isometric perspective but with a different color palette (more earthy, stone textures). The HUD adapts to show capital-specific resources (Capital Gold, Raid Medals).

seasonPass.layout: Horizontal scrolling reward track with free and gold tiers
elements: Reward nodes connected by a path
Free tier (top row) and Gold tier (bottom row)

resourceIcons.gold: Stack of gold coins, circular, warm yellow-gold tone
resourceIcons.elixir: Pink-purple flask or elongated drop shape with a glow effect
resourceIcons.darkElixir: Dark purple-black drop shape, denser and darker than regular elixir
resourceIcons.gems: Green faceted diamond/crystal shape with a shine highlight
resourceIcons.capitalGold: Golden gear or specialized coin with a star emblem

statusIcons.guard: Blue shield with swords crossed behind it
statusIcons.builder: Yellow hard hat or hammer icon
statusIcons.star: Five-pointed star, gold filled when earned, gray outline when not

targetingIcons.ground: Boot or ground symbol indicating ground-targeting
targetingIcons.air: Wing or cloud symbol indicating air-targeting

responsiveLayout.tabletVsPhone: The same layout scales proportionally. On tablets, more of the village is visible at any zoom level. On phones, the HUD elements are proportionally larger to remain tappable.
responsiveLayout.landscapeOrientation: The game is played exclusively in landscape orientation.
responsiveLayout.safeAreas: UI elements respect device safe areas (notches, rounded corners) on modern devices.
